ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: A set of predicates and assertions for checking the state and capabilities of R, the operating system it is running on, and the IDE being used.  This is mainly for use by other package developers who want to include run-time testing features in their own packages. End-users will usually want to use assertive directly.

A set of predicates and assertions for checking the state and capabilities of R, the operating system it is running on, and the IDE being used.  This is mainly for use by other package developers who want to include run-time testing features in their own packages. End-users will usually want to use assertive directly.

name: r-assertive.reflection
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.0-5" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-assertive.reflection
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/assertive.reflection_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/assertive.reflection/assertive.reflection_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: c2ca9b27cdddb9b9876351afd2ebfaf0fbe72c636cd12aa2af5d64e33fbf34bd

build:
  number: 4
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-assertive.base >=0.0_7
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-assertive.base >=0.0_7

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('assertive.reflection')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('assertive.reflection')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://bitbucket.org/richierocks/assertive.reflection
  license: GPL-3.0-or-later
  summary: A set of predicates and assertions for checking the state and capabilities of R, the operating system it is running on, and the IDE being used.  This is mainly for use by other package developers who want to include run-time testing features in their own packages. End-users will usually want to use assertive directly.
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - jenzopr
